title: Bucs release PK Kyle Brindza
text:
Bucs release PK Kyle Brindza 10 News Staff, WTSP 12:25 p.m. EDT October 5, 2015 Tampa Bay Buccaneers kicker Kyle Brindza (2) walks off of the field after an NFL football game against the Carolina Panthers at Raymond James Stadium. Carolina won 37-23. (Photo: Reinhold Matay-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Tampa, Florida -- The Tampa Bay Buccaneers have decided to release PK Kyle Brindza, according to a source from the Tampa Bay Times . 
Bucs writer for the Times , Rick Stroud, tweeted out the news Monday. The news isn't entirely surprising to Bucs fans as Brindza has struggled as of late missing five of his last seven field goals and two extra points (PATs). The #Bucs have decided to release PK Kyle Brindza. He will not be their PK vs Jaguars. Brindza missed 5 of his last 7 FGs and 2 PATs. â€” Rick Stroud (@NFLSTROUD) October 5, 2015 
Stroud says the Bucs met with Brindza this morning and informed him of their decision. Read or Share this story: http://on.wtsp.com/1Le6O5A TOP VIDEOS
